alert.note: Alert for Northern Wayne; Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Susquehanna and northwestern Wayne Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harford, or 10 miles southeast of Montrose, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Clifford, Forest City, Springville, Dimock, Harford, Vandling, Ararat, Hop Bottom and Union Dale. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 206 and 219. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
